bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Nehantic Indians were a tribe of Algonquian-speaking Native Americans living in southeastern Connecticut beginning around 10,000 years ago. They were also known as the Niantic Indians. The Niantics were divided into eastern and western divisions due to intrusions by the more powerful Pequots. During the Colonial Era, the Eastern Niantics lived near the mouth of the Connecticut River.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains miscellaneous documents relating to the history and life of the Nehantic Indians. There are lists of the family names as well as maps of where they lived. Included are research into camp sites and artifacts found in this area.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: Included with the boxes is a collection of books each containing writings on the Nehantics. There are also 12 hanging files in a separate vertical file cabinet.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The East Lyme Historical Society's Thomas Lee House Museum on West Main Street in Niantic, CT displays a collection of Nehantic items.
